titleStmt.title: Certaine very proper, and most profitable similies wherein sundrie, and very many, most foule vices, and dangerous sinnes, of all sorts, are so plainly laid open, and displaied in their kindes, and so pointed at with the finger of God, ... Collected by Anthonie Fletcher, minister of the word of God, ... This present yeere of our happines 1595.
titleStmt.author: Fletcher, Anthonie.

titleStmt.title: Certaine very proper, and most profitable similies wherein sundrie, and very many, most foule vices, and dangerous sinnes, of all sorts, are so plainly laid open, and displaied in their kindes, and so pointed at with the finger of God, ... Collected by Anthonie Fletcher, minister of the word of God, ... This present yeere of our happines 1595.
titleStmt.author: Fletcher, Anthonie.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Iackson, for Isaac Bing,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: Very proper, and profitable similies.
Imperfect; leaves A4 and X4 are lacking.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University. Library.
